item.title: Amazon Fire Stick 4K - ADB Debloat Guide
item.description:
Amazon Fire Stick 4K - Debloat, Remove Telemetry & Advertising

Strip Amazon telemetry, tracking, advertising, and bloatware from a Fire Stick 4K over ADB on port 5555. No root required. All changes are recoverable.

Key Principles

  • Fire OS is a heavily modified Android fork. Amazon layers advertising, telemetry, and shopping on top of the OS.
  • ADB connects over the network on port 5555 (not USB like phones).
  • Use pm uninstall -k --user 0 to remove apps. The -k flag keeps data/cache.
  • Use pm disable-user --user 0 for system-critical packages you want to silence but not remove.
  • Everything is recoverable via cmd package install-existing or pm enable.
  • Do NOT remove settings or launcher core - you will lose the ability to navigate the device.

Prerequisites

Enable ADB on the Fire Stick

  1. Settings > My Fire TV > Developer Options
  2. Turn on ADB Debugging
  3. Note the Fire Stick’s IP address: Settings > My Fire TV > About > Network

Connect from your PC

adb connect <FIRESTICK_IP>:5555
adb devices

Accept the authorisation prompt on the TV screen.

item.title: Google Pixel 8a - ADB Debloat Guide
item.description:
Google Pixel 8a - Stock Firmware Debloat & Privacy Hardening

Conservative debloat and privacy guide for the Pixel 8a on stock firmware. The Pixel is already close to “stock Android” so this is really about stripping Google user apps, reducing telemetry, and tightening battery life.

Key Principles

  • Pixel is already stock AOSP - you’re removing Google’s own apps, not OEM bloat.
  • Use pm uninstall -k --user 0 to remove apps for your user only. The -k flag keeps data/cache.
  • Everything is recoverable via cmd package install-existing.
  • SafetyNet/Play Integrity stays intact, banking apps keep working, OTA updates still apply.

Prerequisites

Enable Developer options > USB debugging on the device.

item.title: Sony Xperia XZ2 Compact - ADB Debloat Guide
item.description:
Sony Xperia XZ2 Compact - Stock Firmware Debloat

Conservative, banking-app-safe debloat guide for the Sony Xperia XZ2 Compact (xz2c) on stock firmware with locked bootloader.

Key Principles

  • Do not unlock the bootloader if banking apps are a hard requirement. Play Integrity / hardware attestation will fail on an unlocked bootloader with a custom ROM.
  • Use pm uninstall --user 0 instead of deleting system APKs. This keeps you recoverable and avoids bootloops.
  • Disable before uninstall for anything you’re unsure about. Test for a day, then uninstall if stable.
  • Reboot and test after every batch - check calls, SMS, camera, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, fingerprint, Play Store updates, and banking apps.

Prerequisites

Enable Developer options > USB debugging on the device.
